help-file.title: PRIEST
help-file.content:
Priests are individuals who choose to spread the faith of their deities through the use of their god-given spell-like powers. The Priest classes are generally charged with the vast responsibility of keeping their party alive with their healing and defensive spells. They are also competent fighters and can hold their own should battle come their way.
There are subclasses of Priest, each with their own specialties: clerics, warlocks, druids, shamans and ethermancers. Clerics are the closest to the common image of a priest: they spread gospel and pray to their deities. Warlocks are Undeads that are very similar to clerics, but have a larger repertoire of utilitarian spells. Druids are calmer folk, who espouse the virtues of closeness and harmony with nature. Though, they can be fearsome when angered. Shamans are a primitive mixture of Priest and Magic-User, with some of the abilities of each, but lacking the full powers of either. Ethermancers use elemental magic and worship the pagan god of storms. The common Priest grouping means the sub-classes are affected by the same class-wide restrictions on equipment and are similar in to-hit rolls and average hit points. Each sub-class has its own experience chart according to which they gain levels.
NOTE: Use "help <classname>" for information on each of the sub-classes.
